result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael E Lazzar

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 18, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Conditions modified on 10/26/2022

NEW CONDITIONS ORDERED ON 10/26/2022:  Defendant to follow all Family Court Orders in 22FA912.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A (contact can be made through Our Family Wizard ONLY) and no violent contact with witnesses A-C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  

PREVIOUSLY ISSUED CONDITIONS:  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

8:34 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Michael E Lazzar in court.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court for Michael E Lazzar.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a motion to modify bail was filed yesterday and inquires if that can be addressed today.  State advises they have reached out to the victim and there is no objection to the request in the motion.  Atty. Baltz presents statements; he is asking the court modify the conditions to allow contact through Our Family Wizard with Victim A and no violent contact with Witnesses A-C.  Court will grant the motion to modify bail as requested; all other conditions to remain as previously set.  Atty. Baltz provides an update; his client needs more time to continue with counseling.  Atty. Baltz requests another further proceedings date in about 30-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of the Conditions of Michael E. Lazzar's Bond filed by Atty. Baltz.
Hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:32 AM; Case called for Hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Michael E Lazzar in court.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court for Michael E Lazzar.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Baltz provides an update, he has discovery but is waiting on an offer.  Atty. Baltz requests another status date in about 30-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:43 AM; Case called for Hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael E Lazzar in court.  Attorney Zak Wroblewski, for attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court with Michael E Lazzar.  Atty. Wroblewski is asking the court to address their motion to modify bail today.  Atty. Wroblewski outlines his requests with respect to bail conditions on the record.  State objects at this time and presents statements.  Atty. Wroblewski responds.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the motion to modify bail at this time; bail conditions will remain as previously set.  Court inquires how the matter is proceeding from here.  Atty. Wroblewski is asking the matter be set for another further proceedings in about 30 days, as he still does not have discovery.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Baltz.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Hearing on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:27 AM Defendant Michael E Lazzar in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

Defense requests the Court to hear the Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail.
The State does not know if victim notification was completed.
The Court will not hear the motion at this time and will adjourn the motion to the Trial Court.
The Court orders the State to notified victims for the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Attorney Jason Baltz

Adjustment Number: 22A 026563,
Payable Number: 469157,
Receipt Number: 22R 028620,
Amount: $20.00
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Laura F. Lau on July 5, 2022
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

USE $1,500.00 CASH BAIL ALREADY ON DEPOSIT.  ($6,000.00 Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster).
If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A (contact can be made under supervised therapeutic/counseling sessions, however needs to written by Victim A and sent to the DA's office) /witnesses A-C (contact through Our Family Wizard, DA to have access to Our Family Wizard) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

03:26 PM Defendant Michael E Lazzar in court, in custody, with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz who appeared by Zoom.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.

The Court recesses at 03:30 PM so the Defendant can call his attorney.
The Court recalls the matter at 3:51 PM with the same appearances.

The Court continues its bail orders.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael E Lazzar
Current: 1816 N 122nd St., Wauwatosa, WI 53226 United States  (Effective: 07-05-2022)
Prior: 12535 W Lakeland Dr, New Berlin, WI 53151
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
